## What is code?
- A set of instructions
- Usually in scripts
- Written using a programming language

## How do you feel about code?

## What is no-code?
- A graphical user interface
- Point and click
- Drag and drop

## How do you feel about no-code?

<iframe width="1050" height="600" src="https://app.sli.do/event/tJ8qTVJwo2tGcoXXwAVQNd/embed/polls/19e87f62-c814-461b-abb8-9d69f53b0c3d"></iframe>

## What is low-code?
- A combination of code and no-code
- Most no-code tools allow code (Excel)
- No-code and low-code can be interchangeable

## How to choose?

- Skills
- Development speed
- Flexibility

## Skills
:::{layout-ncol="2"}
# Code
- <span class="bad">Slower to get started</span>
- <span class="good">Less platform-specific</span>
- <span class="good">More transferable</span>

# No/low-code
- <span class="good">Faster to get started</span>
- <span class="bad">More platform-specific</span>
- <span class="bad">Less transferable</span>
:::

## Development speed
:::{layout-ncol="2"}
# Code
- <span class="bad">Slower to develop</span>
- <span class="bad">Slower to train developers</span>
- <span class="bad">Deployment not included</span>

# No/low-code
- <span class="good">Faster to develop</span>
- <span class="good">Faster to train developers</span>
- <span class="good">Deployment is included</span>
:::

## Flexibility
:::{layout-ncol="2"}
# Code
- <span class="good">Unlimited functionality</span>
- <span class="good">Unlimited design</span>
- <span class="good">Unlimited integration</span>

# No/low-code
- <span class="bad">Limited functionality</span>
- <span class="bad">Limited design</span>   
- <span class="bad">Limited integration</span>
:::
## Other things to consider

- **Reproducability**
- Scalability
- Versioning
- Collaboration
- Integration
- Pricing
